humanum_full_description_en:
The word " cai " in "Shuowen Jiezi" is used as "the beginning of grass and trees", referring to the seeds emerging from the ground. "Shuowen": "Cai is at the beginning of the wood. From the top, the branches and leaves will grow. One is the ground. All talents belong to the talents."

Modern scholars think that the " talent " of the Jia Jin inscription is like a wooden stake or a prong. The contemporary Fang family believes that the Jiajin inscriptions " cai " and " yi " (the first text of "æ™") are a single word differentiation, and the word " yi " omitting the small stroke on the upper right is the word " cai ". Like a wooden stake, the shape of a prong (Chen Jian).

" Only " word later development, is borrowed indicate the presence of verbs and prepositions, and superimposed " persons " as the sound character and made " in " word. From a cognitive point of view, the growth of a kind of seed or the erection of a pile must have a fixed place, so the word " cai " can be extended to "represent the place, time, scope, and object involved in the behavior" (see Xu Zhongshu "Oracle Bone Chinese Dictionary", p.673)

Oracle is pronounced " in ", "Collection" 38223: "only March", that is, in March. It is also known as " disaster " and " ğ¢¦” ", which means disaster, "Tunnan" 1128: "Wang Qishou , die (no) before (disaster)".

Jin Wen said that it exists, Kang Ding: "Wang Cai (in) Kang Palace." It is also known as " Zai ", which means the past, He Zun: "Xi Cai (in) Ercock (Chou) Wen (Wen) King". "The past is" and "the past" are the past and the past. It is also commonly used as the modal particle " Zai ", and the teacher said: "Ai Cai (Zai), today <Min> Tian Jiwei (Wei) mourns." It is also used as a preposition to indicate that the King of Zhongshan Fanghu: "When you are (worship) only (in) get å­¯(xian), it means (second) get the people."
humanum_short_description_en: The word " cai " "Shuowen" refers to the seeds breaking through the ground. Chen Jian believed that the words " cai " and " yi " were originally like wooden prongs. They were borrowed from ancient Chinese characters to mean " being, " referring to where and being, which was extended to just now.

Use the genie out in the open when the primitive appears to the right of or below its relative primitive; in that case it also keeps its same form. The word " cai" in "Shuowen Jiezi" is used as "the beginning of grass and trees", referring to the seeds emerging from the ground. "Shuowen": "Cai is at the beginning of the wood. From the top, the branches and leaves will grow. One is the ground. All talents belong to the talents." Modern scholars think that the " talent" of the Jia Jin inscription is like a wooden stake or a prong. The contemporary Fang family believes that the Jiajin inscriptions " cai" and " yi" (the first text of " æ™") are a single word differentiation, and the word " yi" omitting the small stroke on the upper right is the word " cai". Like a wooden stake, the shape of a prong (Chen Jian). " Only" word later development, is borrowed indicate the presence of verbs and prepositions, and superimposed " persons" as the sound character and made " in" word. From a cognitive point of view, the growth of a kind of seed or the erection of a pile must have a fixed place, so the word " cai" can be extended to "represent the place, time, scope, and object involved in the behavior" (see Xu Zhongshu "Oracle Bone Chinese Dictionary", p.673) Oracle is pronounced " in", "Collection" 38223: "only March", that is, in March. It is also known as " disaster" and " ğ¢¦”", which means disaster, "Tunnan" 1128: "Wang Qishou, die (no) before (disaster)". Jin Wen said that it exists, Kang Ding: "Wang Cai (in) Kang Palace." It is also known as " Zai", which means the past, He Zun: "Xi Cai (in) Ercock (Chou) Wen (Wen) King". "The past is" and "the past" are the past and the past. It is also commonly used as the modal particle " Zai", and the teacher said: "Ai Cai (Zai), today Tian Jiwei (Wei) mourns." It is also used as a preposition to indicate that the King of Zhongshan Fanghu: "When you are (worship) only (in) get å­¯(xian), it means (second) get the people."
